executive_summary.scammer_identity: Huda (claimed to be Senior Web Designer at marketing agency)
key_sophistication_elements: Professional persona with specific job title and company type
Initial profit demonstration and partial withdrawal to build trust
Partnership framing to create emotional investment
Multi-stage fee extraction (taxes, money laundering verification)

tactics.description: Unsolicited approach on social media platform with professional persona
evidence: Approached victim on Facebook
Used persona 'Huda' with professional background (Senior Web Designer at marketing agency)
Established credibility through detailed professional identity

tactics.description: Extended grooming period to establish emotional connection and trust
evidence: Positioned as trading partner, not just advisor
Claimed to be investing own money alongside victim
Created sense of mutual benefit and partnership
Extended interaction over time to deepen trust

tactics.description: False claims of investment expertise and insider knowledge
evidence: Claimed expertise in trading on Trust Wallet
Promised significant profits
Presented as experienced trader with proven track record

tactics.description: Directing victim to fraudulent trading platform under attacker control
evidence: Introduced victim to www.trtuner.top
Platform under complete control of threat actors
Platform designed to display false trading data

tactics.description: Showing fake profits and allowing small withdrawal to build confidence
evidence: Claimed execution of short-term trade with 27% profit
Returned portion of funds back to victim
Created proof of concept that system works
tactics.sophistication_note: This is a key trust-building mechanism - allowing real withdrawal of funds

tactics.description: Gradually increasing victim investment amounts over time
evidence: Encouraged victim to deposit ever larger amounts
Victim continued trading over extended period
Total investments reached $165,000+
Platform showed account value of $190,000 to encourage more deposits

tactics.description: Showing inflated account values to maintain victim engagement
evidence: Platform displayed account worth $190,000
False balance exceeded actual deposits
Designed to show 'success' and encourage withdrawal attempts

tactics.description: First-stage fee extraction when victim attempts withdrawal
evidence: Platform demanded $39,500 in taxes before withdrawal
Victim paid the tax demand
Common pretext in pig butchering schemes

tactics.description: Second-stage obstruction after initial fee payment
evidence: Account frozen after tax payment
Claimed reason: money laundering concerns
Created new pretext for additional fees

tactics.description: Sequential fee demands to maximize extraction before victim realizes fraud
evidence: First demand: $39,500 for taxes
Second demand: $30,000 for account verification
Progressive extraction strategy to maximize losses

tactics.description: Taking down platform after maximum extraction achieved
tactics.mitre_mapping: T1485 - Data Destruction / T1070 - Indicator Removal
evidence: Platform is no longer operational
Occurred after victim unable to extract funds
Prevents further investigation and recovery attempts

techniques.description: Using Facebook as initial contact point
Creating detailed professional identity to appear legitimate
Positioning relationship as mutual partnership rather than advisor-client
psychological_elements: Created sense of shared risk and reward

techniques.description: Referencing legitimate cryptocurrency tools to appear knowledgeable
Allowing initial withdrawal to prove platform functionality

withdrawal_details.purpose: Establish trust and encourage larger deposits

techniques.description: Showing profits that exceed deposits to maintain engagement
techniques.purpose: Encourage withdrawal attempts that trigger fee extraction

techniques.description: Demanding upfront tax payment as withdrawal condition
Using AML concerns as pretext for account freeze and additional fees
Multiple staged fee demands to extract additional funds
Taking platform offline after extraction complete
techniques.timing: After victim unable to recover funds
purpose: Move to new infrastructure for new victims

stages.name: Initial Contact
actions: Introduce professional persona (Huda, Senior Web Designer)

stages.name: Expertise Establishment
actions: Claim expertise in Trust Wallet trading

stages.name: Initial Success Demonstration
actions: Return portion of funds to victim

stages.name: Investment Escalation
actions: Claim to be investing own money alongside victim

stages.name: Account Freeze & Second Fee
actions: Freeze account citing money laundering concerns

stages.name: Final Extraction & Exit
actions: Maintain contact as long as victim might pay more

primary_domain.tld_risk_assessment: HIGH - .top is commonly used for fraudulent sites

victim_deposits.largest_amounts: Later in relationship after trust established

displayed_balance.purpose: Encourage withdrawal attempt to trigger fee extraction

total_loss.note: If victim paid both fee demands, total loss could be $204,500

initial_withdrawal.strategic_significance: HIGH - proves platform works to victim

primary_techniques.implementation: Professional persona with specific job title and claimed trading expertise
Claimed to invest own money alongside victim, framed as mutual endeavor
Initial profit demonstration with actual withdrawal
Progressive escalation of deposits over time
Implicit in trading opportunities and profit claims
Fee demands positioned as necessary to recover existing funds

behavioral_indicators: Unsolicited contact on social media claiming investment expertise
Claiming to invest own money alongside victim
Showing profits that seem too good to be true
Money laundering accusations as pretext for fees
communication_indicators: Persona: 'Huda' - Senior Web Designer at marketing agency

sophistication_factors.description: Allowing victim to withdraw funds initially is advanced trust-building technique
Detailed professional identity with specific job title and expertise claims
Sophisticated psychological manipulation positioning as equal partner
Sequential fee demands with different pretexts shows operational maturity
Fully functional fraudulent trading platform with balance display and payment processing
Platform takedown after extraction prevents investigation

sophistication_assessment.comparison_to_typical_pig_butchering: Above average - particularly the initial withdrawal permission and partnership framing show advanced social engineering

exploited_factors: Hope to recover funds through fee payment
victim_vulnerability_factors.demographic_notes: California resident - no other demographic information provided

investigation_priorities: WHOIS lookup for trtuner.top domain registration
Payment processing analysis - how victim transferred initial $165,000
Blockchain analysis if cryptocurrency was actually used
Search for other victims of trtuner.top platform
prevention_measures: Public education about pig butchering schemes
Warning about unsolicited investment advice on social media
Red flag awareness: upfront fee demands for withdrawals
Red flag awareness: platforms requiring multiple sequential fees
Verification of trading platforms through official channels
Caution about .top and other high-risk TLDs
victim_support: Preserve any platform screenshots showing $190,000 balance
Credit monitoring for potential identity theft

phase_4_initial_success.description: Proof of concept with allowed withdrawal
key_events: Returns portion of funds to victim

typical_pig_butchering_elements: Romance or friendship building - PRESENT (professional friendship/partnership)
unique_or_notable_elements: Partnership framing (claiming to invest alongside victim)
Specific Trust Wallet reference for technical credibility
Money laundering accusation as second fee pretext
comparative_analysis.case_classification: Classic pig butchering with professional partnership variation

financial_impact.justification: Loss of $165,000+ is very high impact

sophistication.justification: High sophistication with initial withdrawal permission and partnership framing

victim_harm.justification: Significant financial and emotional harm over extended period

replicability.justification: Techniques are replicable but require some infrastructure and social engineering skill
